candidates.title: upgrade nanorand to 0.5.2

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body: nanorand generates incorrect random numbers before 0.5.1, see [RUSTSEC-2020-0089](https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/blob/master/crates/nanorand/RUSTSEC-2020-0089.md). It also doesn't support generating signed numbers any more, so this PR adds a workaround for that.

candidates.title: #[test] attribute and related changes

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body:
This does the following:

* Adds #[test] as an function attribute
* Adds a --test flag to rune-cli, allowing tests to be executed
* Adds support for callstacks in Sync code
* Changes how the error messages are printed to split cause, location, and detail into different parts instead of always using "internal vm error" as the highlighted error.

I don't think there are any major issues with the current impl so I'd like to merge this (after some cleanup) and open a bunch of issues for follow-up work. If you think any of these are blockers for merging (or something else) I'm open to discussion! I'm starting to shoehorn more and more things into this PR because the main feature is done, which makes it harder to work with and review.

These are good topics for follow-up work: 

* Add support for cfg-flags for conditional compilation
* Rework rune-cli to have `test` as a subcommand instead of a flag (and add `rune run` as the default command)
  * Add a `--short` mode to tests (`...F..N.E...F` style)
  * Add stdout capture by default for tests and add `--no-capture`
* Add more detail to DebugInst with instruction-specific info, e.g., lhs/rhs spans for ops, and other things.
* Expose test output/running to rune-lsp (maybe dependent/complicates/prevents #73)
* Fix tree-shaking to make test-discovery easier (tracked in #207)
* Convert some tests to Rune level tests instead of testing with Rust

candidates.title: Add fibonacci and brainfuck interpreter benchmarks

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body:
As promised, I've added these two groups of benchmarks, along with some required utilities:

* Vec[...] operator 
* char::from_int converter
* Output redirect for tests
* A macro to create a vm with redirected output for tests

candidates.title: Make it easier to profile Vm

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body:
Wraps all operation handlers in `Vm` with the `op!` macro, which allows for selectively disabling inlining for op functions making them easier to benchmark through the `bench` feature.

`rune-benches` enables this by default.

candidates.title: Introduce first benchmarks

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body:
Also reorg the project so that we have root-level `tests`, `benches`, and `examples`. Due to the way we require dependencies to be handles, these have to be distinct crates:
* `rune-tests`
* `rune-benches`
* `rune-examples`

Note that they won't be published, they're only "support crates" in the repo.

candidates.title: add `file!()` and `line!()` macros

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: changelog
labels.description: Issue has been added to the changelog

candidates.body:
Hello!

From discussion on Discord - this adds the `file!()` and `line!()` macros, which transform into string and number literals representing the current filename and line number (1-indexed). I tried to follow the pattern from `format!()`, but it seems a bit awkward being unable to implement these in runestick, instead feature-gating it in `rune-modules`.

```
➜ cat test.rn
pub fn main() {
   println(`Hello from ${file!()}:${line!()}`);
}

➜ target/release/rune test.rn
Hello from test.rn:2
== () (25.346µs)
```
